text: <a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-1/" title="Song of Solomon 7:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 How beautiful are thy feet with shoes, O prince's daughter! the joints of thy thighs *are* like jewels, the work of the hands of a cunning workman.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-2/" title="Song of Solomon 7:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Thy navel *is like* a round goblet, *which* wanteth not liquor: thy belly *is like* an heap of wheat set about with lilies.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-3/" title="Song of Solomon 7:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 Thy two breasts *are* like two young roes *that are* twins.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-4/" title="Song of Solomon 7:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Thy neck *is* as a tower of ivory; thine eyes *like* the fishpools in Heshbon, by the gate of Bathrabbim: thy nose *is* as the tower of Lebanon which looketh toward Damascus.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-5/" title="Song of Solomon 7:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 Thine head upon thee *is* like Carmel, and the hair of thine head like purple; the king *is* held in the galleries.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-6/" title="Song of Solomon 7:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-7/" title="Song of Solomon 7:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 This thy stature is like to a palm tree, and thy breasts to clusters *of grapes*.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-8/" title="Song of Solomon 7:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 I said, I will go up to the palm tree, I will take hold of the boughs thereof: now also thy breasts shall be as clusters of the vine, and the smell of thy nose like apples;

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-9/" title="Song of Solomon 7:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 And the roof of thy mouth like the best wine for my beloved, that goeth *down* sweetly, causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-10/" title="Song of Solomon 7:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 I *am* my beloved's, and his desire *is* toward me.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-11/" title="Song of Solomon 7:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; let us lodge in the villages.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-12/" title="Song of Solomon 7:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine flourish, *whether* the tender grape appear, *and* the pomegranates bud forth: there will I give thee my loves.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-7-13/" title="Song of Solomon 7:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 The mandrakes give a smell, and at our gates *are* all manner of pleasant *fruits*, new and old, *which* I have laid up for thee, O my beloved.
